snippet: The drug, Iclusig, has been linked to severe heart attacks and strokes, blindness and loss of blood flow in the extremities that can require amputation.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration suspends sales of promising leukemia drug Iclusig, made by Ariad, due to risk of life-threatening blood clots and severe narrowing of blood vessels.
lead_paragraph: The drug, Iclusig, has been linked to severe heart attacks and strokes, blindness and loss of blood flow in the extremities that can require amputation.

headline.main: Serious Danger of Blood Clots Halts Sale of Leukemia Drug
